Hanbyeoggul

Tourist attractions that are good to look around together

Imokdae Historic Sites

5 minutes' walk from Crossing Guest House, 2 minutes' drive

In the 6th year of King Wu's reign (1380) at the end of Goryeo, Yi Seong-gye visited this place where his ancestor, Mokjo, lived and celebrated his victory while defeating the Japanese army at Hwangsan Mountain in Unbong

Donghak Revolutionary Museum

12 minutes' walk from Crossing Guest House, 5 minutes' drive

Located on Seungamsan Mountain in Gyo-dong, Wansan-gu, Jeonju, it is a memorial hall built to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the Buddhist Taegojong Temple Donghak Revolution and consists of a permanent exhibition hall and a memorial hall

Gyeonggijeon Hall

14 minutes' walk from Crossing Guest House, 5 minutes' drive

It is a building built in the 10th year of King Taejong (1410) to enshrine Eojin and perform ancestral rites. It was destroyed during the Japanese Invasion of Korea in 1597, but was rebuilt in 1614 in the 6th year of King Gwanghaegun's reign

Jeondong Catholic Church

14 minutes' walk from Crossing Guest House, 4 minutes' drive

Death Penalty for First Martyrs of Catholicism

Pungnammun Gate

16 minutes' walk from Crossing Guest House, 7 minutes' drive

The southern entrance of the fortress surrounding Jeonju, which was the location of Jeolla Gamyeong during the Joseon Dynasty, is the only remaining gate after the wall was torn down

Ajung Lake

56 minutes' walk from Crossing Guest House, 13 minutes' drive

The trail serves as a health road for nearby residents who enjoy a calm walk

Wanpanbon Culture Center

6 minutes' walk from hanbyeoggul, 2 minutes' drive

Located in Hanok Village, the Wanpanbon Cultural Center was officially opened on October 18, 2011 to preserve various publishing heritage produced in Jeonju and to re-examine the history and culture of Jeonju

Dong-go temple

14 minutes' walk from hanbyeoggul, 8 minutes' drive

Taegojong Temple of Korean Buddhism located on Seungamsan Mountain in Gyo-dong, Wansan-gu, Jeonju

Jeonju Hanok Village

12 minutes' drive from Jeonju Station
7 minutes' drive from Jeonju Express Bus Terminal
-->

Jeonju Hanok Village, which retains the old things in the rapidly changing city, is a place where you can taste the old traditions of Korea
